thread.title: Tasting event to pour $27,000 bottle of rare whiskey
thread.title_full: Tasting event to pour $27,000 bottle of rare whiskey

author: Syd Kearney
title: Tasting event to pour $27,000 bottle of rare whiskey
text:
Tasting event to pour $27,000 bottle of rare whiskey 1 / 11 Back to Gallery 
What does a $27,000 whiskey taste like? 
If youâ€™ve got $1,500 to burn on a foodie experience, you could learn the answer. 
At 7 p.m. Nov. 9, Federal Grill will host a tasting event showcasing one of the rarest single malt whiskies in the world. Only 50 bottles of Glenfiddich 50 Year Old are available worldwide and only six of those are in the United States. A bottle retails for $27,000. 
The evening will feature a multi-course dinner by chefs Matt Brice and Curt Brown. Diners will taste the Glenfiddich 50 Year Old and four other collectible single malts, including Glenfiddich 21, 26, and 40 Year Olds and the 1978 Vintage Cask. 
Glenfiddich ambassador David Allardice, a native Scotsman, will be on hand to discuss the distillery, its history and its collection of whiskies. 
Seating is limited and reservations are essential. Email peter@thefederalgrill.com. 
Federal Grill: 510 Shepherd, 713-863-7777 
Browse the slideshow above to see Houston's best whiskey bars. On The Menu
